ygData.subject: More Thoughts and Questions . . .
ygData.msgSnippet: Salutations All! I have not posted for a while, and I know everyone was probably relaxing a little and here I am again. ... EQ has been progressing prettry
ygData.messageBody:
Salutations All!

I have not posted for a while, and I know everyone was probably
relaxing a little and here I am again.
:o)

EQ has been progressing prettry good for me I think. I've made a
couple of good friends who are more experienced then me and don't
seem to mind giving advice or helping out so that's very nice.

I've also been trying to learn more about my role as a Ranger in
Norrath. I just found out last week what a handy thing taunt can be
when trying to keep a mob off your healer? OK, I'm slow but I'm
getting there I think. And I've gotten duel wield and double attack
now so that's interesting to play with.

Last night a Druid friend and I went to Paudal Cavern for my first
trip there. I would have died twice during the first fight we had I
think if they had not been there to keep me from deaths door. That
was a tough mob and red all the way for me at lvl 19 (20 now).

Anyway, enough ramblin, so it's question time:

1.) I have been asked to get married and have said yes. :o) Any good
suggestions on locations that would be nice but not to hard for
guests to get to? He has a place in mind, I forget the name, but it
sounds like it might be hard for lower level characters to even
reach. I have not traveled over much of Norrath still so I'm not
sure. Anyway, if anyone has ideas I'd love to hear them.
Also, when things are set, which may be a while I'll post a note here
letting everyone know. You are all invited, of course, feel free to
come if you have a character on the Xegony server, of if you want
just create a quick one at the proper time and come anyway. I'd love
to meet anyone who might do me the honor of coming.

2.) Can anyone give me advice on how to find a guild that might be
interested in letting a Ranger in the low 20's join? Would it be ok
to just kind of start asking around? Is there a way to tell a better
guild from one not as good?

Anyway, I hope everyone had a nice Thanksgiving.

Hugs
:o)
Bran
lvl 20 Wood Elf Ranger
